meta.videoTitle: How to Improve Oral Health & Its Critical Role in Brain & Body Health

paragraphList.text_en: Regular tooth brushing and flossing are essential practices in maintaining oral health. The primary goal of brushing is to disrupt the biofilm layer on the teeth that serves as a breeding ground for bacteria like strep mutans. These bacteria, when left undisturbed, can accumulate and form thicker layers known as plaque. Plaque, if left unchecked, can eventually harden into tartar. Tartar is a hardened deposit that cannot be removed by regular brushing and flossing and requires professional cleaning by a dentist. The formation of tartar can be reduced by diligent removal of biofilm and plaque through regular oral hygiene practices.
paragraphList.text_zh: 定期刷牙和使用牙线是保持口腔健康的基本做法。刷牙的主要目标是破坏牙齿上的生物膜层，而生物膜层是变形链球菌等细菌的滋生地。这些细菌在不受干扰的情况下会积聚并形成更厚的斑块层。牙菌斑，如果不加控制，最终会硬化成牙垢。鞑靼是一种硬化的沉积物，无法通过定期刷牙和使用牙线去除，需要牙医进行专业清洁。通过定期的口腔卫生实践，勤清除生物膜和牙菌斑，可以减少牙垢的形成。

paragraphList.text_en: Strep mutans bacteria have a tendency to form strand-like structures within the biofilm layer, resembling little strings or Celia. As this biofilm accumulates, it can become thicker and mossy in appearance, transitioning into plaque. When plaque is not adequately removed, it can develop into tartar, which poses a greater challenge for oral hygiene maintenance. Tartar can have a yellowish tint and requires thorough cleaning by a dentist to prevent dental issues such as gum disease and cavities.
paragraphList.text_zh: Strep mutans细菌有在生物膜层内形成链状结构的趋势，类似于小细绳或Celia。随着这种生物膜的积累，它会变得更厚，外表长满苔藓，转变为斑块。当牙菌斑没有被充分去除时，它可能会发展成牙垢，这对口腔卫生维护构成了更大的挑战。鞑靼可能呈黄色，需要牙医彻底清洁，以防止牙龈疾病和蛀牙等牙科问题。

paragraphList.text_en: Tooth polishing, a common procedure during dental visits, involves smoothing the surfaces of the teeth to make it harder for biofilm to adhere and reduce the formation of plaque and tartar. While tooth polishing can enhance the shine of teeth, its primary purpose is to create a smooth surface that hinders bacterial attachment. This process aims to promote oral health by minimizing the accumulation of plaque and tartar, especially in hard-to-reach areas of the mouth.
paragraphList.text_zh: 牙齿抛光是牙科就诊期间的一种常见程序，它包括平滑牙齿表面，使生物膜更难粘附，并减少牙菌斑和牙垢的形成。虽然牙齿抛光可以增强牙齿的光泽，但其主要目的是创造一个光滑的表面，防止细菌附着。这一过程旨在通过最大限度地减少牙菌斑和牙垢的积累来促进口腔健康，尤其是在口腔难以触及的区域。

paragraphList.text_en: In addition to professional dental care, daily oral hygiene practices play a crucial role in preventing the buildup of biofilm, plaque, and tartar. Brushing and flossing regularly and correctly can help disrupt the bacterial colonies on the teeth and reduce the risk of dental issues. By maintaining a consistent oral health routine and prioritizing the removal of biofilm at an early stage, individuals can minimize the formation of plaque and tartar, ultimately supporting their overall oral health.
paragraphList.text_zh: 除了专业的牙科护理外，日常口腔卫生实践在防止生物膜、牙菌斑和牙垢的形成方面发挥着至关重要的作用。定期正确地刷牙和使用牙线可以帮助破坏牙齿上的细菌菌落，降低牙齿问题的风险。通过保持一致的口腔健康习惯，并在早期优先清除生物膜，个人可以最大限度地减少牙菌斑和牙垢的形成，最终支持他们的整体口腔健康。
